content:
Vegan yogurt alternatives have come a long way in recent years, and there are many delicious and versatile options you can use as a base for your slow cooker yogurt. Here are some popular ones:

1. **Soy Yogurt**: Made from soy milk, this is a classic vegan yogurt alternative. Look for brands like Silk or So Delicious.
2. **Coconut Yogurt**: Coconut-based yogurts are creamy and rich, making them a great base for slow cooker yogurt. Brands like So Delicious, Coconut Bliss, or Coyo are popular choices.
3. **Almond Yogurt**: Made from almond milk, this is a low-calorie and low-fat option. Brands like Almond Breeze, Silk, or So Delicious offer almond-based yogurts.
4. **Cashew Yogurt**: This is a creamy and indulgent option, often made by blending cashews with water and then straining the mixture. You can find cashew-based yogurts from brands like So Delicious or make your own at home.
5. **Oat Yogurt**: Oat-based yogurts are a great option for those with nut allergies or intolerances. Brands like Oatly or So Delicious offer oat-based yogurts.
6. **Rice Yogurt**: Made from rice milk, this is a hypoallergenic and easy-to-digest option. Brands like Rice Dream or So Delicious offer rice-based yogurts.
7. **Hemp Yogurt**: Hemp-based yogurts are a great source of protein and omega-3 fatty acids. Brands like Good Karma or Elmhurst 1925 offer hemp-based yogurts.
8. **Flax Yogurt**: Flax-based yogurts are a great option for those looking for a low-calorie and high-fiber base. You can find flax-based yogurts from brands like Good Karma or make your own at home.

When choosing a vegan yogurt alternative, make sure to select an unflavored and unsweetened variety to avoid adding extra sugars or flavorings to your slow cooker yogurt. You can always add your own flavorings and sweeteners later to taste.

Remember to always check the ingredient list and nutrition label to ensure the product meets your dietary needs and preferences. Happy slow cooker yogurt making!
